result.execSummary:
The defendant Antwanesha M Reese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Straight Time.

miscConds.notes: *Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the period of probation. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.

*Defendant Not possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription. Take all medications in the manner as prescribed.
*NO contact with victim Adriane R.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antwanesha M Reese in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Antwanesha M Reese in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve 240 days (STRAIGHT TIME) in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 8 (eight) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 100 days (STRAIGHT TIME)
           consecutive in the House of Correction. 
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
          Take all medications in the manner as prescribed. 
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with victim Adriane R.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the period
          of probation. 
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due 
          immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights; received and filed.

Defendant Antwanesha M Reese in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Antwanesha M Reese in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Due to the lateness of the hour,  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR NEXT SCHEDULED HEARING.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Antwanesha M Reese not in court, in custody at Taycheedah Correctional and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Antwanesha M Reese not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case calendared for plea hearing. Court unable to hear case due to a jury trial.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.
Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Antwanesha M Reese not in court, in custody, not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Status conference held. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Antwanesha M Reese not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.    Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, additional time needed to review with client.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Adriane R

Defendant Antwanesha M Reese in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Antwanesha M Reese in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
